column1: Hardware Assets - Lost/Stolen or Recovered Assets - Automation Improvements
column46:
Multiple gaps and issues we have related to devices that are considered lost, stolen or recovered by a Liberty Mutual employee.

Identify multiple personas and workflows we currently have in place, then identify the gaps or improvements we have. A focus on security, device integrity and customer experience. Possibly come up with automation or improved processes that we can introduce to the DWE Team (Windows, Mac and Mobile).

Purpose will be to build out a workflow diagram that we can bring to DWE and other involved to present our findings and possible solutions.

10/20/25 - Lost/Stolen - Engagement Form and Workflow DiscussionÂ  ([Web view|https://libertymutual-my.sharepoint.com/personal/kevinj_hill_libertymutual_com/_layouts/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7b175E9DD1-EF89-4204-A1D8-13E42E26B7F1%7d&wd=target%28My%20Inventory.one%7C00961458-0E6F-45D7-9E83-DD4DA4B242DC%2FLost%5C%2FStolen%20-%20Engagement%20Form%20and%20Workflow%20Discussion%7C38431F77-8FB9-4105-891E-DB53A105EA89%2F%29&wdpartid=%7b741DF142-AE60-0369-1822-D4628620A4BD%7d%7b1%7d&wdsectionfileid=%7b58B1F1DE-DE67-49C5-A173-BE1D6A1361A8%7d])

30/Sep/25 2:41 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;To Do - [https://lucid.app/|https://lucid.app/]:

* Create a Lucid Chart to Use for collaboration
* Build out with a easy to follow workflow based on the following personas:
** Report Lost/Stolen - Windows
** Report Lost/Solen - Mac
** Report Lost/Stolen - Mobile (Corporate, Aircard, etc.)
** Report Lost/Stolen - All other devices
** Recovered Lost/Stolen - Windows
** Recovered Lost/Stolen - Mac
** Recover Lost/Stolen - Mobile (Corporate, Aircard, etc.)
* Document the current Workflow used by each of involved parties:
** Customer Engagement
** L1 Engagement
** L2 Engagement
** L3 Engagement
** Security or GCS
* Identify the Gaps in the process:
** Security Risks or Potential Risk
** Workflow or Process Restrictions or Issues
** Customer Experience Failures
* Workflow or Automation Improvements

column1069: 01/Oct/25 10:00 AM;61ee7e446fa12a0070325bcf;Alexâ€™s plan is solid for current devices; the problem we have is we have a significant number of devices that are still unaccounted for that are old - Windows 10 devices, etc.  Would also like to see Nexthink looped in as it can get current encryption results as well as last IP and logged in user.  We also need to have a way to reverse things when someone submits a report for a device that is in use.

Not really solving for the issues in this first discussion, more about identifying each persona, device type and support workflow then evaluate the gaps for each so we can present DWE and Nexthink teams with something concrete - and Yes we also want to review Recovered devices as well. Looking at this with a holistic lens for asset related issues (outside of ordering a new device)

column1072:
23/Oct/25 1:35 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Weekly Meeting/Discussion Topics:*+

* Identify primary pain points and Gaps in process - prioritize these with the team
** Existing HR/Talent Form - Needs to be retired or why is this form existing (HR/Talent question)
*** This does NOT work for ANY assets (PC, Mac or Mobile)
** Windows/Mac - Lost/Stolen (existing US Domestic Lost/Stolen form):
*** User Facing - Report their own device and/or manager report on their behalf (lower priority)
**** Agent Facing - Bare minimum for L1/L2 ability to submit form/engagement (Sr Agent approval) (higher priority)
**** Data captured and stored to fulfill the SO300 request (is this needed) (lower priority)
*** Form Submission - Action Items:
**** 1 - Initiate Remote Wipe
***** Success: Continue to Automation/Notification
***** Failure: Likely will not come online (Isolate? Crowdstrike? containment?)
****** If comes back online - Falcon containment
****** Doesnâ€™t comes back online (theft person knows PIN) - TBD (60 days for Win / 90 days for Mac) - Nexthink to remove local user account?
**** 2 - Automation and Notifications
***** SO300?? - requirements within this form (what is needed / what is not needed)
***** IT/InfoSec
****** Initiate Remote Wipe/Lock via Intune/JAMF/MDM
****** Log attempted wipe
***** Security Operations (SecOps)
****** Investigate incident 
****** Coordinate with police if necessary
****** Track personal property (if reported)
****** Update incident status 
***** Human Resources (HR)
****** Receive status of device/property report
****** Provide employee support resources
****** Track compliance and follow-up actions
**** Device/Property Investigation/Wait Period (X days)
***** Ongoing updates to SecOps, HR, IT
***** Communication with employee
**** Is Device Recovered?
***** TBD - based on steps above (Asset and Legal)

13/Nov/25 10:12 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Lost/Stolen - Meeting Notes/Discussion:*+

*Reporting Discussion â€“*

* Identify the manual process as of today and what weâ€™d like to do to automate
** Snow form submitted
** Engagement submitted to CSOC
** Unknown any other engagements sent or who is notified (Talen, Asset, etc.)
** Tier 2 works the Task ticket â€“ custom support group (Wipe or remove from network, decrypt drive, etc.)
** Recent ask to replace CSOC engagement
* Submitted by the customer to report lost/stolen â€“ no approval necessary (queryâ€™s their devices signed in by user)
** OK to remotely wipe the device (Windows, Mac and Mobile)
* Tier 1 â€“ submitted on behalf of â€“ would like to have approval or maybe Sr Agent to agree before automated wipe sent
** Sr Agent confirms device and allows the remote wipe (Windows, Mac and Mobile)
* CSOC engagement when a remote wipe command sent but device is checking in consistently (if beyond 60 days)
** This should require a CSOC investigation ticket â€“ to take further action
* API Call from ServiceNow to Intune Remote wipe (Windows/Mobile)
** Currently only able to do this with currently logged in user (no option to submit On Behalf)
** Verify if the manager can submit the Lost/Stolen on behalf of the employee
** Extend this to allow for Tier 1 to submit on behalf of user for lost stolen (with Sr Agent Assist)

*CSOC & HR/Talent Requirements -* 

* Tamatha - question â€“ using HR form, a case is created and submits to SecOps team
** Appears that some cases are picked up and worked by SecOps
* SecOps unknown what action they will take â€“ on lost/stolen form
** Depending on what was stolen and what actions they take
** Is this just a database or notification portal
** Determine if this is just informational
* HR/Talen only creates a ticket to SecOps â€“ ALL Company Property Type
** Sarah Dotson and Tamatha, Baily â€“ Lindsay Lynch to make changes to existing form
** At least to stop people from using this for mobile, windows, mac or other hardware assets
** Determine if SecOps has any requirements when it comes to these or if they just need to be informed that the asset has been reported
* Follow up with SecOps team, Alex, Jim and Michael to discuss further

column1077:
14/Nov/25 9:32 AM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;Great and yes, the guardrails question continues to be a focus of conversation as we begin to design this out. We just had a good discussion with HR/Talent who confirmed that they donâ€™t take any actions with the items submitted through their version of the lost/stolen device form â€“ they simply engage SecOps to take whatever action they need to on that asset.

We have a follow up call with SecOps next week to try and determine exactly what actions they take, what they need, and any specific requirements if we move this process over to ITSM form for lost/stolen. Itâ€™s starting to look like HR/Talent has no need for their specific form, that itâ€™s all around SecOps so the hope would be we can keep this process simple as there appears to be some outdated workflows with that groups existing form and process.

Are there any specific questions from your team we should ask next week or confirm? This is a high-level discussion on finding out what they would need if we make this move to ITSM form â€“ not necessarily a feasibility discussion.

[^RE_ Lost_Stolen Devices (Windows_Mac_Mobile) - Future State (dafab1b1-51e1-47b7-90c4-6b494735086c).msg]
column1078:
19/Nov/25 10:54 AM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Meeting Notes/Discussion - SecOps Requirements:*+

* *Lost* - SecOps not too concerned and not need to be notified (maybe no police report needed)
* *Stolen* - SecOps would like to be notified - for ALL Thefts and on any products
** OK to have device Wiped prior to notifing SecOps? - OK to wipe
** Require or ask for Police Report? Would like to have a Police if applicable
** Can the existing form be hidden from PROD so not searchable from HelpHub - or is there a need for it live now?
** EOL SO300 form by end of Feb 2026
** Confirmed that Lost/Stolen myInventory form does notifiy SecOps for ALL assets that come through

Need to determine and confirm what type of action or information SecOps needs when a user reports one of the following items as Lost/Stolen:

* *BYOD Phone / Tablet (Personal)* - Stolen Only?
* *Corporate Mobile Device* - Stolen Only
* *Documents* - Lost/Stolen
* *Other Equipment/Materials/Objects Not Mentioned Above* - Lost/Stolen
* *RSA Token - Yubikey?* - Lost/Stolen Both
* *Tablet* (Co or Personal)
* *Thumb/USB Drive* - Lost/Stolen Both
* *Wireless LAN/MiFi* - Stolen Only
* Add *Keys or Hard Keys* - Lost/Stolen

Suggestion to move these into myInventory portal to capture ALL assets into a singe location and create custom workflows for anything SecOps needs to be notified and/or where this database is stored so both Tech Help and SecOps can access the data.

* If we need to maintain 2 separate Lost/Stolen, then I suggest all physical Assets live under the myInventory Lost/Stolen and HR/Talent record maintains ALL Other items
* Also discuss what Lost/Stolen fields are required for SecOps or what they need

column1081:
24/Nov/25 3:09 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Meeting/Notes - Discussion (*+[~accountid:61ee7e446fa12a0070325bcf] +*/*+ [~accountid:61ee353458ce4f00686ce54f] +*/*+ [~accountid:62fea7a96d26632889df0633] +*)*+

{quote}Nan â€“ question on Managers responsibility when an employee is gone and no longer in possession of the device{quote}

*Lost/Stolen Process - Window 11/Mac â€“ Tier 2 Workflow:*

* Lost/Stolen US Domestic submission
* Creates a Task if Bitlocker encrypted â€“ Auto triggered?
** Active encryption â€“ checks Nexthink first (last time it was seen and last public IP address)
** Adding that info to the Task
** Then Intune â€“ (for Mac use Jamf) check serial number and device is still showing as reported as â€“ check device compliance
** If not in either location, checks ServiceNow CMDB â€“ April 2024 (transitioned to fulfiller)
*** If unable to verify encryption â€“ sending to Legal Data Security, CSOC L2 and Asset Management Hardware
*** Close the Task â€“ Resolution (closed complete)
**** If device is still in use, then mark as (closed incomplete)
* Same time gets an INC to remove from AD (including Mac) â€“ Auto triggered?
** Windows 11 â€“ Nothing to Remove â€“ close ticket (script to auto close)
** Apple Mac â€“ No process to remove from Jamf etc.
** Windows 10 â€“ Shane Ray script looks for present device and if itâ€™s disabled â€“ must be disabled first then automation to remove from AD (closes ticket)
* Windows 11 â€“ If no interest in recovering device, could initiate Wipe on initial step.
** Does bitlocker encryption need to be completed prior to a Wipe? â€“ Check first and get encrypted
** Does a device need to be in compliance to perform the wipe? â€“ Not required

FYI [~accountid:61ee99ce5a0988006b1dce93]
column1082:
10/Feb/26 2:26 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Meeting/Notes Discussion Items for Jamf Wipe Options:*+

*Steps to Wipe a Computer in Jamf Pro:*

# Log into Jamf Pro and search for the computer.
# Click the *Management* tab.
# Select *Wipe Computer*.
# Enter a 6-digit passcode (required but only applies to Intel devices to unlock the device after wipe).
## Call out in scripting that this could be any series of numbers (123456)
# Click *Wipe* to send the command.
# Optional step - go check that the command was sent under Management History
## If device is Recovered prior to connecting it to the internet, wipe command can be cancelled

Meeting/Notes Discussion Items for Jamf Wipe Options:

Steps to Wipe a Computer in Jamf Pro:

  1.  Log into Jamf Pro and search for the computer.
  2.  Click the Management tab.
  3.  Select Wipe Computer.
  4.  Enter a 6-digit passcode (required but only applies to Intel devices to unlock the device after wipe).
     *   Call out in scripting that this could be any series of numbers (123456)
  5.  Click Wipe to send the command.
  6.  Optional step - go check that the command was sent under Management History
     *   If device is Recovered prior to connecting it to the internet, wipe command can be cancelled

column1103: No Epic Alignment

column1: myAsset Management - Process for Devices Not Provided by Fulfillment Team
column46:
Concerns around managers hoarding these older Win10 devices and issues we are having trying to get these migrated to Win11. There is no process to create a Win11 Gold Disk, would be difficult to create a Win10 Gold Disk and then attempt to migrate to Win11 machine.

Need a documented process on what expectations manager will have if and when calling L1 with an older device that was previously provisioned for an employee no longer working for that manager.

This would include ANY hardware asset (Desktop, Laptop, Mac) - create a KB or process outlining what actions to take and provide info for managers to understand reasons why we donâ€™t want to Hoard these devices.

*myAsset - Process Update on Managers Hoarding Devices*Â  ([Web view|https://libertymutual-my.sharepoint.com/personal/kevinj_hill_libertymutual_com/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fpersonal%2Fkevinj_hill_libertymutual_com%2FDocuments%2FNotebooks%2FHardware%20or%20Device%20Support&wd=target%28BreakFix%20Changes.one%7CFDC364A3-A4EB-4D07-AD7A-6F87F347E604%2FmyAsset%20-%20Process%20Update%20on%20Managers%20Hoarding%20Devices%7CBD09408D-469F-41B9-AC05-DD29B60C4530%2F%29])

*SM&D/DWE Partnership Meeting - 6/6/2024*Â  ([Web view|https://libertymutual-my.sharepoint.com/personal/kevinj_hill_libertymutual_com/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fpersonal%2Fkevinj_hill_libertymutual_com%2FDocuments%2FNotebooks%2FHardware%20or%20Device%20Support&wd=target%28BreakFix%20Changes.one%7CFDC364A3-A4EB-4D07-AD7A-6F87F347E604%2FSM%26D%5C%2FDWE%20Partnership%20Meeting%20-%206%5C%2F6%5C%2F2024%7C5F2194CB-E813-44B0-97DC-3B69945F90F8%2F%29])

23/May/24 3:37 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;Tyler - Employees still holding onto older Wind10 devices

* Trying to onboard these older Win10 devices and migrate them to Win11
* Not able to build out a Win11 Gold Disk to get these migrated
* However if customer has a Win10 device L2 could possible to build a Win10Â  device
* Managers asking for a Win11 Gold Disk
* Instructions should be to Return the Win10 to Deployment (regardless of model/type)
** Then ask customer to order a replacement Win11 device
** Let Hardware Asset management to determine
* We need this process scripted out and a communication out to management
** L1 scripting will be helpful for our Tech Support position
** Process Should Include:
*** Order a New Win11 device
*** Return your old Win10 device
*** Do NOT try to migrate older device to Win11
*** How to determine if this is the situation - maybe if the manager is the one calling L1
*** If employee states device was handed to them from manager and did NOT come in myAsset box or shipped to employee
*** [https://us.myliberty.lmig.com/work-life/employee-handbook-company-policies/corporate-technology-resources|https://us.myliberty.lmig.com/work-life/employee-handbook-company-policies/corporate-technology-resources]
*** Let's script it out as a broader discussion with customer to include ANY computer device, not just Win10
* If employee leaves the company, they MUST return the asset
** Rolls up to the manager
* If you change department, your asset maintains and changes to the new manager

20/Jun/24 12:25 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;Hi [~accountid:62feb1e588b05653fa7dd612]  - Iâ€™m actively working to identify articles where we can add L1 process steps urging customers to request a replacement device if the following criteria is determined:

* Device was handed to employee and not shipped directly to them (did it show up in a box?)
* Employee still working on Windows 10 laptop (not in exception group) - offer Win11 upgrade
* Manager calls in asking for a Windows 11 Gold Disk - ask manger to return device and order replacement for employee

Instructions should be to Return the Win10 to Deployment (regardless of model/type)

* Then ask customer to order a replacement Win11 device
* Let Hardware Asset management to determine

Solutions where these might be helpful to add L1 detailed steps to return device and order replacement:

* [START HERE: New Hire needs assistance with initial Start Date Setup|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0016642]
* [How to: Manager needs to prepare a Windows computer for a new hire, transfer or terminated employee|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0022497]
* [New Hire - Purchase a New Computer|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0020780]
* [Manager - New Hire Portal|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0023721]
* [Windows 10: Image / Reimage User Guide|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0022485]
* [Windows 10: How to make a bootable USB for imaging/reimaging a computer|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0022530]
* [Windows 11: Device Migration and Configuration|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0023770]
* [Windows 11: Initial Device Setup|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0023454]
* [Windows 10: 'We can't sign you in with this credential because your domain isn't available' error|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0016793]
* [Windows Access: New hire cannot login to new computer using temporary password. 'Specified login'|https://libertymutual.service-now.com/esp?id=kb_article&sysparm_article=KB0016175]

Not sure we want or need to add these additional L1 checks to all of these articles, but would like to identify which would provide the most value add with these updates.

FYI [~accountid:61ee37ce632452006b4cd214]

* *Email #1:Â Annual Asset Review - Weekly email includes employee and direct manager*
** Sent to all employees and contractors with a physical LM device annually on their work anniversary
** Users without physical LM devices are excluded
** End users or their manager can complete thisÂ required Annual Asset Review
* *Email #2: Asset in Transit - Weekly email includes employee and direct manager*
** Sent when a physical device has been marked as shipped - in-transit to an employee or contractor, but not the device has not been activated on the LM network within 14 days
* *Email #3: Down Device - 1st email includes employee and direct manager. Weekly emails include the managerâ€™s manager to the escalation.*
** Sent to US-based employees and contractors with a physical LM device that has not connected to the LM network within the last 30 days
** Non-US users will remain out of scope for these e-mails until a later date (to be determined)

Â 

The following exclusions apply where e-mails will +not+Â be triggered:Â 

* L1/L2 executives
* Users marked as on leave in People@Liberty (this generally applies only to US-based users, non-US users on leave may receive e-mails)
* Users on the asset management e-mail exception list
** Technology Asset Management can be engaged via their [Service Desk|https://forge.lmig.com/issues/servicedesk/customer/portal/488]Â for appropriate additions to be made to the exception list, use cases may include:Â 
*** Non-US executives
*** Non-US users on long-term leave
*** Other special use cases with business justification
* China users â€” China users are excluded from ServiceNow HR data import processes used for e-mail notifications

column1: CyberArk Migration: All Remaining Unix Managed Accounts are Migrating to Delinea Secret Server; Due: 2/20/2026
column46:
*Originating Market* - GCS Identity & Access Management (IAM) - Privileged Access Management

*What is Happening?*

As a part of Libertyâ€™s enterprise modernization of the Privileged Access Management (PAM) strategy and technology, GCS IAM is implementing Delinea Secret Server (SS), a cloud-first, scalable, cost-effect, and resilient solution. Delinea SS will replace CyberArk enterprise password vault, *and the use-case that is migrating next is all remining Unix managed accounts.*Â Â 

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To strengthen governance over privileged IT credentials, bolster security, and increase control and compliance.Â  This modernization propels efforts to Safeguard Business Operations, Digitalize our Future, and Make IT Spend Count.Â Delinea Secret Server will simplify workflows for managing privileged access, reducing complexity for both tech and business users.Â Â Â Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Attaching impact in the next few days.  Selecting all markets until we have final impact breakout.

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

The target migration date for remaining Unix Managed accounts is the end of February 2026.Â  Closer to the migration, additional communications with information and resources will be shared that will be catered towards this use-case.Â Â Â 

+Prepare to use Delinea SS+:Â Â 

* Adapt and get familiar with the new user experience in Delinea SS.Â Â Â Â 

* Prioritize time to test permissions prior to migration cutover.Â Â Â Â 

* Teams using automation (CyberArk APIs) will need to adjust their applications to switch over to Delinea SS APIs.Â Â Â Â 

+Action end users need during migration:+Â 

* Review onboarding guide and FAQs - [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GISDAC/pages/1596657260/Delinea+Connection+Manager|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GISDAC/pages/1596657260/Delinea+Connection+Manager|smart-link] Â 

* Verify you have access to migrated folder/safe in Delinea via:Â 

* Web portalÂ 

* Install Delinea Connection Manager from Liberty App Portal and verify accessÂ 

* Test RDP connection after migrationÂ 

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

Lose access and lack of awareness with the new PAM process for Unix managed accounts.Â 

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Not at this time, but in progress

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?* CyberArk retirement in 2026.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

Impacted end-users and managers will get an email communication once we finish gathering data.Â Â 

* Access more information [+*here*+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GISDAC/pages/1405059751]*.*Â Â 

* View our Market Action Center Informational Post [+here+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/browse/GCH-353].Â Â 

* Request access to 2024 Secure Development program video and materials titled â€œPrivileged Access Management: How We Protect Our Assetsâ€ through MCDC [+*here*+|https://mycareerdevelopmentcenter.libertymutual.com/mcdc/LSM.html?link=%252fDeepLink%252fProcessRedirect.aspx%253fmodule%253dlaunchtraining%2526lo%253d1022c5e0-e449-4c82-bc73-efdbccf43f9a]*.*Â Â 

* View and add yourself as w a â€˜watcherâ€™ for the â€œPrivileged Access Management (PAM) Modernization Plan and Progressâ€ wiki page [+*here.*+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GISDAC/pages/1513306657/Privileged+Access+Management+PAM+Modernization+Plan+and+Progress]Â Â 

* View Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Wiki [+*here*+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GISDAC/pages/1523982603]*.*Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Juliana Mooney

column1: SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED for local development and testing
column11: Link to our documentation on using certstore.lmig.com https://forge.lmig.com/wiki/display/CMS/Certificate+Management+Services+Home
column46:
Hello,
I'm working on the RAE Loss Lens Processing Service and need assistance with SSL certificate configuration for local development on my machine.
*Issue:* When running the service locally, I'm encountering SSL certificate verification errors when making HTTPS requests to Liberty's internal API endpoint:
*Endpoint:* [lm-cf-openai-api-tst01.apim.lmig.com|http://lm-cf-openai-api-tst01.apim.lmig.com] and various others
*Error:* [SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed: unable to get local issuer certificate
*Context:*
This issue only occurs on my machine - my colleagues can run the service locally without SSL errors
I'm using Python 3.11 with the httpx library for HTTP requests on macOS on PyCharm. However, Iâ€™ve seen this error arise for Python 3.12 and 3.13 as well.
I have already gone through the Zscaler Developer Onboarding doc and have added the certificate file on PyCharm and have gone through the other Mac Setup instructions.
*What I Need:*
The appropriate CA certificate(s) to trust Liberty's internal domains (specifically *.apim.lmig.com)
Instructions on how to install/configure these certificates for local development on macOS
Confirmation on whether my local environment is missing something my colleagues have configured
*Repository:* lmigtech/rae-loss-lens-processing-service
Could you please provide guidance on obtaining and configuring the correct certificates for my local development environment?
Thank you!
Best regards,
Angela Cui

column1: NFS Cleanup Initiative
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GDS

*What is Happening?*

In the beginning of 2026, we will commence our NAS cleanup initiative. The first phase will focus on cleaning up NFS volumes that is directly associated with Unix machines.

+Technical Context:+ NFS shares are hosted on NetApp storage systems, and their access is tightly coupled to Unix machines (both physical servers and virtual machines). Each NFS volume has specific client access ( in form of DNS names/IPs of unix machines)  permissions configured at the NetApp level.

This data-driven approach will enable us to safely offline volumes where all associated Unix machines are non-responsive, while selectively cleaning up individual clients for volumes with mixed connectivity status.

+Current State Analysis+

Based on comprehensive connectivity testing across the NetApp environment:

* Total Volumes Analyzed: 1,493 volumes
* Volumes with All associated clientâ€™s ping/DNS Failed Status: 809 volumes (54%)
* Logical Capacity of volumes where All associated clientâ€™s ping/DNS  Failed Volumes: 354.87 TiB (363,391 GiB)

+Strategic Approach+

Phase 1: Remove Inactive/Non-Pinging Clients from NFS Volumes

Objective: Safely offline or clean up NFS volumes where Unix client machines are no longer accessible.

Methodology:

* If all Unix machines associated with a volume are down â†’ Take volume offline
* If only some machines are down â†’ Clean up inactive clients only, leave volume active
* All decisions based on DNS resolution and ping connectivity tests

+Non-Production volumes+: Deleted 3 months after being offlinedÂ 

+Production volumes+: Deleted 6 months after being offlinedÂ 

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

+Benefits+:

* Immediate capacity reclamation potential: 354.87 TiB
* Reduced storage footprint and associated costs
* Improved storage performance and management
* Better understanding of actual data access patterns

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

There should be NO disruptions to any active applications.Â All actions are taken only on clients which are not active (unreachable or offline systems). We have verified the connectivity status of each client before determining the appropriate action.Â 

Active clients will continue to operate normally with no service interruptionÂ 

* Only inactive/unreachable clients will have their access permissions removedÂ 
* Volumes serving active clients will remain online and fully operationalÂ 
* Volumes with no active clients will be offlined with appropriate grace periods before deletionÂ 

+Backout+: In case of any issues, volumes can be quickly bring back online and access can be restored.

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

App owners will be informed via emails and will provide their specific volume list as well in that email, the email will have below actions for them to take. Please check email template here, [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPM/pages/1888718897/Email+Template+to+Volume+Owners|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPM/pages/1888718897/Email+Template+to+Volume+Owners|smart-link]

+Next Steps for App Owners+: The specific action planned for each of your volumes is documented in the *"Next Action"* column of the attached volume summary report.Â 

* *Review*: Please review the attached volume summary report for your assigned volumesÂ 
* *Validate*: Confirm the accuracy of the planned actions for each volumeÂ 
* *RESPOND - ACTION REQUIRED*: *Please open a service desk ticket within 15 business days using the link below in the following cases:*Â 
** If you want to retain a volume that is marked for Offlining
** If the Troux application/ID is retired but Unix clients are still active - you must update the Troux ID with the current active application
** If you believe an application or volume has been incorrectly assigned to you - update the ownership informationÂ 
** Any other questions or concerns

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

* Volumes with no active clients will be offlined with appropriate grace periods before deletionÂ 
* Volumes serving active clients will remain online and fully operationalÂ 
* Non-Production volumes: Deleted 3 months after being offlinedÂ 
* Production volumes: Deleted 6 months after being offlinedÂ 

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPM/pages/1891238405/NFS+Cleanup+Initiative|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPM/pages/1891238405/NFS+Cleanup+Initiative|smart-link] 

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?* After 1 week of Market Action Center tickets, we will start our phase where we will inform app owners about their volumes and they will have 15 days to submit tickets to us.

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources:* [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPM/pages/1891238405/NFS+Cleanup+Initiative|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DPM/pages/1891238405/NFS+Cleanup+Initiative|smart-link]

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Kyle Welenc, Chintan Patel

column1: KDC Exit: Application Validation Plans for Testing and Cutover needed
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GDS

*What is Happening?*

As part of the KDC Exit initiative as we finish up the DR move to Columbus OH (CDC) we are shifting our focus to the big cutover from KDC to Ashburn VA (ADC). As part of this effort we are requesting that all application teams with workload running or calling workloads that run out of the KDC datacenter develop end to end validation plans, automation scripts etc. to ensure that during the upcoming KDC test/simulation cutover events and during the final cutover weekend teams will know how to perform a full application validation and signoff of their application post cutover to ADC.

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

Ultimately the KDC exit project is driving this request but the rational for this work is to enhance the cutover and minimize risk duing the cutover weekend

A datacenter cutover isnâ€™t just a physical move of servers and network infrastructure. It involves changes to the underlying environment including power, network configurations, hardware, and potentially data access pathways. Even the most stable applications can behave differently after such transitions due to subtle environmental changes.

Validation helps us:

* *Confirm Application Availability:*Â Ensuring the app comes up properly in the new environment.
* *Verify Performance:*Â Catch any degradation in response times or throughput.
* *Check Integration Points:*Â Confirm connections to databases, APIs, and third-party services remain intact.
* *Identify Data Integrity Issues:*Â Validate that no data corruption or loss occurred during migration.

Without these checks, problems might only surface after the cutover, potentially causing downtime and ultimately impacting our business operations.

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

All applications identified in the KDC Exit effort and KDC asset inventory are in scope of this effort. [+[GCH-241] KDC Datacenter Migration and Exit by April of 2026 - Jira+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/browse/GCH-241]

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

To minimize risk and ensure business continuity, developers need to:

# *Document Current Application Architecture:*Â Understand and map out all components and dependencies.
# *Create a Validation Plan:*Â Define what to test, how to test it, and what success looks like.
# *Prepare Automated and Manual Tests:*Â Use existing test suites or build new ones tailored for the post-cutover environment.
# *Coordinate with Infrastructure Teams:* Align resources with the TBD test cutover schedules and fully understand any configuration changes needed for the apps.
# *Schedule Dry Runs or Staging Tests:* Whenever possible, test the application and validation plans in an environment that closely mirrors Ashburn colo and during the TBD test cutover schedules.
# *Plan for Rapid Issue Resolution:* Have support teams ready to troubleshoot and fix any issues immediately after cutover.

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

If the actions are not completed by this date, then we are at risk of delays in fixes and unforeseen issues that may arise during our test cycles and post cutover to the ADC datacenter from KDC. This could cause delays in signoff and longer lasting issues that could have been addressed prior to the cutover event.

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, LPAR and VM inventory - [+In-Scope Migration to Ashburn.xlsx+|https://libertymutual.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/sites/HSIntegrationsandDivestitures/Kansas%20City%20Datacenter%20Exit/1.%20Inventory%20%26%20Planning/Ashburn%20Datacenter/In-Scope%20Migration%20to%20Ashburn.xlsx?d=w4efe7fb39d9c47dc9287e4694ab5ea56&csf=1&web=1&e=GlqjWc]

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

The due date is being driven by the overall KDC exit program dates and by the start of 2026 we need to be ready to move into the test phase of the program with teams ready to test and validate applications in AWS for the scheduled test cycles and cutover event in April that canâ€™t move.

*Where should I store this information about my application validation plans.*

We are asking all teams to use the following SharePoint site to store this information

[Application Test Plans|https://libertymutual.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/sites/HSIntegrationsandDivestitures/Kansas%20City%20Datacenter%20Exit/4.%20Testing%20%26%20Validation/Application%20Test%20Plans?csf=1&web=1&e=ga0iOd]

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*
[+Communities â€¢ Powered by Workvivo+|https://communities.myliberty.lmig.com/news/222643]

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Brian Morse

column1: BladeLogic Retirement: RO & ROOT Roles - target retirement Feb 25
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GCS

*What is Happening?*

To align with LM's Tech strategic priority of safeguarding business operations, BladeLogic (BL) will be retiring with a target date of mid-October 2025.

* Read-Only & Root BL roles will be move to a standard Privileged Access Management (PAM) pattern utilizing Delinea Secret Server (SS), a cloud-first, scalable, cost-effective, and resilient solution.Â Â  Â 

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

BladeLogic is legacy, unsupported, and has risk findings associated with the environment.  

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

The target migration date is mid-October. Â Closer to the migration, additional communications with information and resources will be shared that will be catered towards this migration.Â  We will ensure a testing period where both patterns will be available prior to BladeLogic shutdown to minimize impact.

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Closer to migration, prepare to use Delinea SS:

* Additional validation on use-cases and requirements may be needed.Â 
* Adapt and get familiar with the new user experiences.Â 
* Prioritize time to test permissions prior to migration cutover.Â 

Impacted end-users, managers, and POs will get an email communication once we have more information and directions to ensure end-users have proper access.Â Office-hours will be held leading up to the migration for testing and questions, with hypercare support provided after BladeLogic shutdown. 

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

Lose access and lack of awareness with the new process for BladeLogic replacement.

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Not at this time, but in progress

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

Patch management not possible leaving us exposed to current and future security risks and lack of vendor support.  

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

[https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GISDAC/pages/1596657260/Delinea+Connection+Manager|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GISDAC/pages/1596657260/Delinea+Connection+Manager|smart-link] 

Planning:

* Leadership stakeholder conversations
* Targeted communications
** Linking to wiki pages / training
* Office hours leading up to retirement

03/Feb/26 12:17 PM;70121:5524e2e8-fddc-4d62-ac53-3e583f27f591;*BladeLogic Read-Only (RO) updates:*

* Communication was sent today (2/3) to end-users and aligned managers on the BL RO retirement date of week of 2/16. (Based on the end-users who requested the new AD group membership for this pattern)
* Office hours set up for the end-users and managers who are in the new pattern (new AD Group membership was looked up)
* Please note - 47% of the new pattern groups are still empty - could be because legacy roles and no longer needed OR lack of response to our email notifications (we send multiple emails).  We will attempt to do some â€œchasingâ€ for empty roles the next two weeks.

*BladeLogic Root updates:*

We know a majority of root roles are already available in Delinea based on the CyberArk root to Delinea migration.  We will work with impacted users (~43) and managers to ensure they have what they need in Delinea by having focused conversations by team.  Forecasting end of February retirement for BL ROOT.

column1: AWS WAF Everywhere: All Externally Facing AWS resources must be protected by a Web Application Firewall (WAF)
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GCS Global Security Services (GSS) - Architecture

*What is Happening?*

All externally facing AWS resources will be required to be protected by a Web Application Firewall. Resource types in scope for this effort:

* AWS API Gateway REST APIs (Edge and Regional)
* AWS CloudFront
* -Application Load Balancer- (removed from scope)
* AWS AppSync GraphQL API
* Amazon Cognito user pool
* AWS Amplify

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

Having AWS resources that are not protected by a WAF significantly increases the risk of account compromise and data breach. By requiring that these resources leverage the appropriate CSPE-managed WAF policy, we can significantly reduce that risk.

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Any owners of AWS resources that are not currently protected by a WAF

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

There are two categories of resources we will be addressing: existing and net-new resources.

+Action required for Existing Resources:+

# The GDS CSPE (Content Security and Performance Engineering) team will deploy internal and external WebACLs to any accounts identified as unprotected (resources currently without WAF protection)
# Resource owners will need to apply the â€œintended_exposureâ€ tag to their resource
# Resource owners will need to associate the appropriate WebACL to their resource to become compliant.

+Action required for Net-New Resources+: Following this change, Radar will require the following actions to create a new resource:

# Upon creation, resource owner will need to add the correct â€œintended_exposureâ€ tag to their resource
# Resource owner must associate a CSPE-managed WebACL to their resource. The WebACL applied must match the â€œintended_exposureâ€ tag (ex. If a resource is tagged as intended_exposure = internet_facing, it must have an external WebACL associated).

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

+Existing resources+: If no action is taken, the resources will be flagged as non-compliant by radar, but will not be destroyed

+Net-new Resources+: If net-new resources do not follow the Radar rule requirements, they will be destroyed. New resources will only be allowed to be created if they follow these actions:

# Add â€œintended_exposureâ€ tag
# Associate appropriate CSPE-managed WebACL

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Resource owners can check their compliance status using this sample CloudForge Discovery Radar Compliance Report: [https://discovery.lmig.com/sqlpad/queries/e4e02649-1df8-4532-825a-8a03ad96a1c6|https://discovery.lmig.com/sqlpad/queries/e4e02649-1df8-4532-825a-8a03ad96a1c6]

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

Teams should begin inventorying and planning immediate remediation now (tagging, IaC changes, associating WebACLs).

+Enforcement Schedule - Destructive remediation for newly created resources:+

* {{2026-03-02}} â€” SANDBOX/DEV: Radar enforcement (enforce WebACL association; nonâ€‘compliant new resources destroyed).
* {{2026-03-16}} â€” NONâ€‘PROD: Radar enforcement begins (2â€‘week interval).
* {{2026-03-30}} â€” PROD: Radar enforcement begins (2â€‘week interval).

+Existing nonâ€‘compliant resources (owner remediation):+ Radar will not autoâ€‘destroy existing nonâ€‘compliant resources during this remediation window but leave remediation tasks up to the affected teams

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

# Cloud Communities Post: [+Communities â€¢ Powered by Workvivo+|https://communities.myliberty.lmig.com/news/256100]
# GDS CSPE AWS WAF Onboarding & Automation Guides:

* [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CSPE/pages/313360861/AWS+WAF+Onboarding|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CSPE/pages/313360861/AWS+WAF+Onboarding|smart-link]
* [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CSPE/pages/313360496/AWS+WAF+Automation|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CSPE/pages/313360496/AWS+WAF+Automation|smart-link]

# Sample CloudForge Discovery Radar Compliance Reporting: [+https://discovery.lmig.com/sqlpad/queries/e4e02649-1df8-4532-825a-8a03ad96a1c6+|https://discovery.lmig.com/sqlpad/queries/e4e02649-1df8-4532-825a-8a03ad96a1c6]
## Please note: query may load blank when first opened. If you encounter this, please reload/refresh the page and query will appear

* +GCS Architecture+: Tom Landeis, Zach Bornstein 
* +Project Mgr+: Kris Wilson 
* +GDS CSPE Contact+: Rama Kulkarni
* +GCS Threat & Vuln Mgmt:+ Kurt Wondra, Craig Newcomb

column1074: 12/Jan/26 5:54 PM;70121:0c81bb5b-472e-4d2c-af70-bc5b2699c63b;The subject says â€œ+_All_+ _AWS Resources_â€œ and the description says â€œ+_all externally facing_+ _AWS resources_â€œâ€¦ which is it?
column1075:
13/Jan/26 9:18 AM;61eeabb125edab006af95cfa;[~accountid:70121:0c81bb5b-472e-4d2c-af70-bc5b2699c63b] Hi Brian! It actually is externally facing only.Â  By externally facing, we mean a resource reachable from the Internet.Â  So, the scope is externally facing AWS resources that support WAF.

Â 

Thereâ€™s confusion with the terminology, because we have target systems that are intended to be internal, but are reachable through some of these externally facing resources.Â  Like API Gateway.Â  So the flow is Internet Ã  API Gateway Ã  VPC resource such as an EC2 instance.Â  So, we have â€œinternalâ€ WAF policies that allow access to externally facing resources like API Gateway, but use network ACLs to limit access from Liberty Mutual public IP addresses only.Â  But the resource in scope for WAF Everywhere, the API Gateway, is externally facing.

Â 

The subject should be All externally facing AWS resources. I will make that update now. Thanks for raising this!

column1103: Root Cause Problem Solving

column1: Datadog API Key Exposure
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GDS

*What is Happening?*

The Observability team coordinated with the Secrets Management team to rotate the key the Datadog AP key stored in teh global secret. The current key will be revoked on March 6, 2026. Teams have until that date to redeploy and pick up the new key.

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

On November 26, 2025, the Datadog API key stored in the global secret was exposed publicly. The Observability team coordinated with the Secrets Management team to rotate the key. The exposed key will be revoked on March 6, 2026.

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

All application teams using the global Datadog API key documentedÂ [+HERE+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SECMAN/pages/1014547796/Global+Secrets]Â must redeploy their applications so they pick up the rotated key.

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

A redeploy of an application using Datadog any time before March 6th will pick up the rotated key with no disruption in service.  For any applications currently part of the 90 day redeploy cycle this will be completed in time.  For those that are exempt from 90 day redeploys a manual redeploy should resolve to the issue.

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

If you do not redeploy by March 6, 2026, your applicationâ€™s observability logs, metrics and traces will stop being sent to Datadog.

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes

[+https://app.datadoghq.com/notebook/13544869/dd-global-secret-exposure+|https://app.datadoghq.com/notebook/13544869/dd-global-secret-exposure]

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

The current key will be revoked on March 6th, 2026.

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

[+https://communities.myliberty.lmig.com/news/253538+|https://communities.myliberty.lmig.com/news/253538]

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* James Sullivan

column1: Update Authentication Pattern for External APIs - Risk Rating & Pricing - No impact
column46:
*Originating Market* - GDS

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[+Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 

+Change Dates:+Â 

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

05/Jan/26 12:42 PM;61ee58c49e89390069f53c76;[~accountid:70121:3aa5cf4c-cab1-4db0-9b5d-09513919089f] Not overly familiar with the config setup in the ApigeeX proxies, but yes it appears that its using API Keys and then using the Oauth client ID/secret to call the LM groundspeed integration service.

!image-20260105-174014.png|width=633,height=477,alt="image-20260105-174014.png"!
column1071:
06/Jan/26 11:27 AM;61ee58c49e89390069f53c76;Groundspeed have confirmed that they support OAuth and have opened a ticket with their technical team to support the transition (GS contact: Chad Roth).

The ApigeeX Proxy needs to be updated to validate/authenticate the Groundspeed OAuth token versus using an API Key:

[https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link] 



!image-20260106-162642.png|width=362,height=209,alt="image-20260106-162642.png"!

NB: groundspeed-x-proxy is already using OAuth for target authentication to the groundspeed integration service.
column1072:
09/Jan/26 5:54 AM;61ee58c49e89390069f53c76;Steps:

* Coordinate with GS to send an OAuth token. They would call [https://api.us.libertymutual.com/oauth/token|https://api.us.libertymutual.com/oauth/token] to get a token for the proxy.
* Guidance Documentation including how to make changes to an ApigeeX Proxy using the Dashboard:[https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/1612746853/Getting+Started+with+Apigee+X+Proxies|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/1612746853/Getting+Started+with+Apigee+X+Proxies|smart-link] 
* Switch from using 'verify-api-key' to 'verify-oauth-v2-access-token' policy.
* NB: for reference the default proxy in groundspeed-x-proxy (/groundspeed) uses the â€˜verify-oauth-v2-access-tokenâ€™ policy (Apigee Oauth)

!image-20260109-110009.png|width=563,height=617,alt="image-20260109-110009.png"!

* Another example proxy using verify-oauth-v2-access-token: [https://github.com/lmigtech/Apigee-X-Health-Proxy/blob/main/apiproxy/proxies/default.xml|https://github.com/lmigtech/Apigee-X-Health-Proxy/blob/main/apiproxy/proxies/default.xml|smart-link]
column1073:
21/Jan/26 7:00 AM;712020:d4f699d2-2d91-4f97-8e5e-f8db8a7e74ad;*Assumption* - to validate we can rename an existing file upload. it should return the same data in JSON and arrive in the S3 bucket and we can compare the two objects for the postman call. There should be no reason to include Renee and team in this process.

h4. Business Value / Benefit of making this change:

* Reduces the chance of unauthorized access to Liberty Mutual systems and sensitive data through external connections
* Meets required security and audit commitments, avoiding reportable findings and related remediation work
* Improves accountability and oversight by clearly tying external usage back to approved partners and applications

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
h4. Impact / Risk if the change is not made on time:

* External connections may become difficult or impossible to update, causing delays to fixes, enhancements, and releases
* Increased risk of audit issues and security non-compliance, leading to escalations, exceptions, and unplanned work
* Higher likelihood of exposure from weaker access controls on external connections, with potential legal, financial, and reputational impact

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}

CFTHOR-4919
Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ Legal Tech
*Originating Market* â€“ GDSÂ 

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen

{color:#ff991f}Discussion during PI 1/26/2026. We want to aim for handling this quickly but there is also the element of coordinating changes with the vendors.  Unless these are deployed the 2/8/2026 will not break the apigee. Though we may be unlikely to meet the deadline, we are not pursuing an exception right now.  We can still test CIQ Inbound. {color}

NOTE: The only Apigee project we have impact on is ni-pal-claims-apigee-proxy

h4. Business Value / Benefit of making this change:

* Reduces the chance of unauthorized access to Liberty Mutual systems and sensitive data through external connections
* Meets required security and audit commitments, avoiding reportable findings and related remediation work
* Improves accountability and oversight by clearly tying external usage back to approved partners and applications

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
h4. Impact / Risk if the change is not made on time:

* External connections may become difficult or impossible to update, causing delays to fixes, enhancements, and releases
* Increased risk of audit issues and security non-compliance, leading to escalations, exceptions, and unplanned work
* Higher likelihood of exposure from weaker access controls on external connections, with potential legal, financial, and reputational impact

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen

If there is no impact, please set this issue to CLOSED.

If there is known/unknown impact, please set this issue to ANALYZE.
Create desired backlog issues in team/squad Jira project, and Link issue "related to" this Epic.

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen

column1103: Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ EDATA

column1: Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ EDATA 2025-12-10 - 2026-03-08 -Data Loading Van Duong  & Matt Therault
column46:
CFTHOR-4917
Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ EDATA
*Originating Market* â€“ GDSÂ 

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen

Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ EDATA 2025-12-10 - 2026-03-08 - Reference Rangers - Eric Martin & Jared Doyle 

CFTHOR-4917
Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ EDATA
*Originating Market* â€“ GDSÂ 

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen

Since your Epic is in an Open status, please ensure your status is up to date before our next Architect/Managers/SE's Horizon's meeting. If this work is in progress, a story from your backlog should be linked for visibility and tracking purposes until it's resolved.

If your team is not impacted, please close this issue.

CFTHOR-4917
Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ EDATA
*Originating Market* â€“ GDSÂ 

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

*Originating Market* â€“ GDSÂ 

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen

Since your Epic is in an Open status, please ensure your status is up to date before our next Architect/Managers/SE's Horizon's meeting. If this work is in progress, a story from your backlog should be linked for visibility and tracking purposes until it's resolved.

If your team is not impacted, please close this issue.
