CFTHOR-4917
Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ EDATA
*Originating Market* â€“ GDSÂ 

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â

h4. Business Value / Benefit of making this change:

* Reduces the chance of unauthorized access to Liberty Mutual systems and sensitive data through external connections
* Meets required security and audit commitments, avoiding reportable findings and related remediation work
* Improves accountability and oversight by clearly tying external usage back to approved partners and applications

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
h4. Impact / Risk if the change is not made on time:

* External connections may become difficult or impossible to update, causing delays to fixes, enhancements, and releases
* Increased risk of audit issues and security non-compliance, leading to escalations, exceptions, and unplanned work
* Higher likelihood of exposure from weaker access controls on external connections, with potential legal, financial, and reputational impact

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}

column1: Horizons: Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ Legal Tech - Due: Mar 8, 2026
column46:
CFTHOR-4919
Modern Auth Enforcement for External (Apigee) APIs â€“ Legal Tech
*Originating Market* â€“ GDSÂ 

*What is Happening?*

API Management platform will enforce modern authentication for all external APIs by 3/31/26.Â The deployment process will Fail (exception required) for externally facing proxies that do not implement OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping).Â  See more details in wiki:Â 

[Proxy Authorization Requirement and IDP Selection Guidance - Enterprise API - Confluence|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance]Â 



*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen



{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h4. Business Value / Benefit of making this change:

* Reduces the chance of unauthorized access to Liberty Mutual systems and sensitive data through external connections
* Meets required security and audit commitments, avoiding reportable findings and related remediation work
* Improves accountability and oversight by clearly tying external usage back to approved partners and applications

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
h4. Impact / Risk if the change is not made on time:

* External connections may become difficult or impossible to update, causing delays to fixes, enhancements, and releases
* Increased risk of audit issues and security non-compliance, leading to escalations, exceptions, and unplanned work
* Higher likelihood of exposure from weaker access controls on external connections, with potential legal, financial, and reputational impact

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}

To ensure we are delivering a secure, enterprise-grade API Management platform that aligns withÂ  cybersecurity regulations and External API Security Standards- ensuring compliance, protecting sensitive data, and enabling trusted digital innovation.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Externally facing proxies that do not implement an acceptable form of OAuth (Apigee, Azure, Ping)Â 

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

Â 

*Timeline:*

* *Dev/Test: 2/8/26* Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Dev and Test Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change) Â 
* *Prod: 3/8/26*Â 
** Enforcement will be implemented in the Prod Apigee Organizations. Any proxies not remediated will be impacted with this change)Â 



*LIFTED Impacted Areas*

Â Analytic Platforms & Services (Brown): Unknown

Â Legal Technology (Szostak): Unknown

Â Global Finance Technology (Taylor): Unknown

Â Global T&ES (Bradfish): Unknown

Â Strategy & Shared Services (Butler): Unknown

Â 

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

Proxy owners need to switch to a different type of Authentication Pattern. Guidance can be found here: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENTAPI/pages/330236398/Proxy+Authorization+Requirement+and+IDP+Selection+Guidance|smart-link]  Â Â 



*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

New deployments targeting new or existing proxy revisionsÂ will fail and display a message to the user instructing them to remediate or seek [an exception|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/150/group/1024].Â 



*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/reports/a8fd2dda-b5e3-4fc2-bb23-bc5ae50efb05/ReportSection5d01a4e0cea1cb302005?experience=power-bi|smart-link] . To use the Power BI report, filter API Type = API Key and keep the 'external_endpointâ€ filter selected.



*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

To comply with GCS recommendations for risk remediation. Timeline is also driven by a requirement to close and ELT reportable Audit finding.Â 

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

MAC ticket to inform proxy owners. Resources will be created to help proxy owners implement changes.Â Â Â Â 

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Evelyn Jansen



{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h4. Business Value / Benefit of making this change:

* Reduces the chance of unauthorized access to Liberty Mutual systems and sensitive data through external connections
* Meets required security and audit commitments, avoiding reportable findings and related remediation work
* Improves accountability and oversight by clearly tying external usage back to approved partners and applications

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}



{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
h4. Impact / Risk if the change is not made on time:

* External connections may become difficult or impossible to update, causing delays to fixes, enhancements, and releases
* Increased risk of audit issues and security non-compliance, leading to escalations, exceptions, and unplanned work
* Higher likelihood of exposure from weaker access controls on external connections, with potential legal, financial, and reputational impact

 _This content was generated by LibertyGPT and should be reviewed for accuracy._
{panel}

column1: Atlassian API Tokens Lifecycle
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GDS

*What is Happening?*

The vendor has begun enforcing API token expirations, including any legacy API tokens created prior to December 15, 2024. The API tokens created before December 15, 2024, are backfilled to expire in one year. These API tokens will expire between March 14 and May 12, 2026.

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

The vendor is enforcing API expiration dates. This helps strengthen our security posture by enforcing the rotation of api keys.

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Users and system accounts that have created API tokens before December 15, 2024 will need to create a new API token if needed and update any downstream automation/systems that are consuming that token.

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

There are roughly 145 API tokens that were created before December 2024 that have a date last used that has a date of 2025. If those API tokens are important, they will need to be recreated and replaced where current API tokens are being used. How to create a new token can be found here: [https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-api-tokens-for-your-atlassian-account/|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-api-tokens-for-your-atlassian-account/|smart-link]

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

If no action is taken, the API token will expire and will no longer return any Atlassian data after the expiration date.

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, see attached.

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

Vendor selected the date. Legacy API tokens have been backfilled with an expiry date starting on {{2026-03-13}}

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

* [+Atlassian Changelog+|https://developer.atlassian.com/changelog/#CHANGE-2403]
* [+Manage API Tokens+|https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-api-tokens-for-your-atlassian-account/]

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Justin Millette

column1: Crowdstrike Falcon Sensor Certificate Rotation
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GDS

*What is Happening?*
Falcon cloud SSL/TLS certificates for US-1, US-2, EU-1 and US-GOV-1, which terminate the sensor to cloud TLS connection, will be rotated on March 16, 2026, in advance of a scheduled certificate expiration.

*Why is it Happening?*
These rotations are part of CrowdStrikeâ€™s commitment to ensuring the continued authenticity and integrity of the sensorâ€™s cryptographic trust model.

*Who is Impacted/In Scope for this Initiative?*
Application teams using AMIs with an older sensor version will be impacted.Â  A list of AWS accounts deploying AMIs with older sensor versions is provided below.Â  Please note not all AMIs built under these accounts will be affected by this certificate rotation.

*Market(s) Impacted?* - USRM, GRS, LIFTED, GCS, GDS

*What Actions do those impacted need to take?*
Update build process to use the current standard Liberty Mutual AMI, OR update your build process to use the newest version of the Falcon sensor located here: 
[https://libertymutual-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/p/henry_carr/IgDmHj4m5m_hRavTbL8aut_zARLOaHGmdcib_LV6KBn7m80|https://libertymutual-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/p/henry_carr/IgDmHj4m5m_hRavTbL8aut_zARLOaHGmdcib_LV6KBn7m80]

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date??*
Failure to update the Falcon sensor version will result in loss of security protection and lost visibility of the instances. 

*Do you have an impact list?* Yes, [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HES/pages/2051015442/AWS+accounts+with+outdated+AMIs+public|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HES/pages/2051015442/AWS+accounts+with+outdated+AMIs+public|smart-link] 

*What is Driving the Due Date?*
Vendor driven due date.

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*
Impact List: [https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HES/pages/2051015442/AWS+accounts+with+outdated+AMIs+public|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HES/pages/2051015442/AWS+accounts+with+outdated+AMIs+public|smart-link]

column1: Troux Replacement Coming in 2026
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GDS

*What is Happening?*

We are retiring the Troux SaaS product and building and building a UI replacement for a short-term tactical plan.

* Training for users (Admin, IT Owners, Stewards, Market Leads) will be in the form of a new APM Knowledge Center, which will be ready on 3/9 for the cutover
* Users in system 3/9

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

+Significant Technology Risk+

* Ongoing stability and performance issues
* Collectors failing weekly
* System crashes during server clean-up
* Data quality issues
* Outdated technology
* Limited subject matter expertise

+Financial Uncertainty with Vendor+

* Unknown cost or commitment term if we need to renew this contract in April 2026

+Unintended Usage beyond APM+

* Troux now supports broader use cases; recent examples include myAccess and Power Automate.
* Metadata fields have been repurposed for non-APM needs; e.g.â€œExternal Facingâ€

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

Users of the Troux SaaS application

There are a very limited number of applications that are impacted by this initiative. Those application owners are aware and are a part of the initiative. 

Most data our LM applications use flow from Troux to ITODS, reports pulling â€œTroux Dataâ€ are actually pulling from ITODS and will not be affected by this initiative.

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* CF/LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

No action at the moment, we will have training for Troux users only in 2026

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?* N/A

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)? Yes, see attached* (Impacted parties have already been contacted and have been collaborating with Troux team)

column1073:
22/Dec/25 10:54 AM;70121:24da0643-79bb-4e01-b42b-f8b8c55f59fc;*EMAIL UPDATE SENT OUT TO TROUX USERS & STAKEHOLDERS 12/15/2025:*

Â 

*Troux Retirement Update*

Â 

Dear Troux Users & Stakeholders,

As part of our ongoing efforts to improve the way we manage our application portfolio and technology assets at LM, I want to share an important update regarding our work to retire the Troux application.

We are retiring Troux and migrating its data into CloudForge Console, LeanIX, and ServiceNow. This affects everyone who maintains or consumes APM/application data.

Â 

*Our progress*

Our goal remains to ensure a smooth transition to our new APM MVP solution with minimal downstream data impacts.Â  Over the last few months, our teams have:

* Worked with market leads to assess our current APM practices and identified enterprise-wide dependencies on Troux.
* Designed a new APM user interface (UI) within CloudForge Console to provide a better experience for those maintaining application data.
* Partnered with LeanIX and ServiceNow to define process improvements and map selected Troux Fields (Attributes) into their applications.

Â 

*What this means for you*

Beginning Mar 1, 2026, edits to attributes must be made in the mapped target system shown in the field mapping below (CloudForge Console, LeanIX).

Â 

*Key dates*

* Pilot: January â€“ February 2026
* Target Cutover (new tools become authoritative): March 1, 2026
* Troux retirement: April 29, 2026

Â 

*Action required: Review Troux Field Mappings (due Jan 9, 2026)*

Â 

* Review the field list below.
* If you rely on any field listed as â€œAbandoned,â€ send an email by January 9^th^ Â to Suzanne Meeves and me with the subject line: â€œTroux Field Concern.â€ In your message, include:
** Field name
** Your use case
** Business impact if the field is removed (Optionally include contact info and suggested alternatives.) For more detail, see: [Troux Metadata/Field Dictionary â€” Application Portfolio Management|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TROUX/pages/502990174/Troux+Metadata+Field+Dictionary] (Confluence).

Â 

*Abandoned Fields:* these will not be populated in the new tools; historical values will be archived and available on request

Â 

|Short Name|
|Secondary Datacenter Location(s)|
|Business Suites|
|Uses E-Mail|
|(Security Tab) GDPR|
|(Security Tab) Data Subjects|
|(Security Tab) EU Data|
|(Security Tab) US data|
|(Security Tab) Data used by application|
|Acronym|
|Number of Production Offices|
|Interfaces|

Â 

*Go Forward Fields*

|*Field Name (Attribute)*|*New Location*|*Change to Data Stewardship/Maintenance?*|
|Name|Console (Also visible in ServiceNow)|No|
|Description|Console|No|
|UUID|Console (Also visible in ServiceNow)|No|
|Phase|Console (Also visible in ServiceNow)|No|
|Installation Date|Console|No|
|Retire Date/ Target Retirement Date|Console|No|
|Retirement Date Change reason|Console|No|
|Recommendation|Console|No|
|Recommendation Comments|Console|No|
|Replaces Application/ Replaced by|Console|No|
|Active Servers|Console|No|
|Application Category|Console|No|
|IT Owner|Console|No|
|Support Owner (Support Group)|Console|No|
|Business Owner|Console|No|
|Servicing Roles|Console|No|
|Contained by Category(Domain)|Console|No|
|Owning Organization|Console|No|
|Supports User Departments|Console|No|
|Originating Company|Console|No|
|Number of User Accounts|Console|No|
|Production 24 x 7|Console|No|
|Availability Designation|Console|No|
|Compute Environments|Console|No|
|Has Financial Impact|Console|No|
|External Facing|Console|No|
|Data Security Level|Console|No|
|EXTERNAL Application URLs (Not editable)|Console|No|
|Disaster Recovery Designation|Console|No|
|Child Of|Console|No|
|Primary Datacenter Location(s)|Console|No|
|DR Configuration|Console|No|
|Architecture Roadmap|LeanIX|Yes, Architecture to maintain in go forward solution|
|Target State|LeanIX|Yes, Architecture to maintain in go forward solution|
|Architecture Model|LeanIX|Yes, Architecture to maintain in go forward solution|
|Cloud Capability|LeanIX|Yes, Architecture to maintain in go forward solution|
|Compute Model|LeanIX|Yes, Architecture to maintain in go forward solution|

Â 

*Additional Notes:*

* Service Level Agreements has no new source yet and will not be included in MVP
* Application to Server relationships will be maintained in ServiceNow
* Services will no longer be captured
* Training materials, quick guides, recorded demos, and a migration FAQ will be posted to the project page (link still to be published). We will send step by step access instructions before cutover.
* Your Market Leads will remain your primary hands-on contacts for the pilot, cutover, and post cutover phases. They will validate mappings, coordinate local validation, help with integrations/reports, schedule training, and escalate issues. Market leads and contacts can be found here: [Troux Learning Center â€” Application Portfolio Management|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TROUX/pages/820837115/Troux+Learning+Center] (Confluence).

Â 

*Questions or Concerns?*

We are here to support you. Please feel free to reach out with any questions, concerns, or feedback.

Thank you for your continued partnership as we work to modernize our application management and deliver even greater value to LM.

Best regards,
AJ Wasserman

GDS â€“ Strategy, Data & Delivery

column1076:
16/Feb/26 1:55 PM;70121:24da0643-79bb-4e01-b42b-f8b8c55f59fc;Email that went out today is below.



To:	 All Troux Users & Stakeholders	 

{code:none}February 16, 2026{code}

A message from AJ Wasserman

 Troux Retirement Update

Last year we shared plans to retire Troux and replace it with a more sustainable Application Portfolio Management (APM) solution. Iâ€™m pleased to report the new APM tool is nearly ready, and we have set the formal cutover date.

Key information and next steps
â€¢	Cutover date: Monday, March 9, 2026. This is the date when:  
o	The new CloudForge Console User Interface (UI) becomes the APM system of record.
o	ServiceNow becomes the system of record for Application-to-Server Relationships.
o	LeanIX becomes the system of record for Application Enterprise Architecture metadata.
o	From March 9 onward: Do not create or update any Applications in the Troux Product, including Application-to-Server relationships. All APM activities must be initiated and maintained in the new Console UI and all Application-to-Server relationships must be managed in ServiceNow.

â€¢	Process changes: The new system will alter current workflows. We have coordinated closely with Market (SBU) Leads to design a smooth transition and to limit data disruption. If you have access to Troux, you will have access to the new APM system.
â€¢	SBU responsibilities: Your SBU Lead remains your primary contact for any organization-specific APM procedures and approvals. Engage them first for process-related questions.
â€¢	Resources: Visit the APM Knowledge Management area in Console for an APM overview, links to â€˜how-toâ€™ resources, and SBU-specific process pages. Check them before contacting your SBU Lead.
â€¢	Support and feedback: We appreciate your partnership as we modernize our APM capabilities and Make IT Spend Count. If you encounter issues, have concerns, or want to share feedback, reach out through the support channels listed in the APM Knowledge Management area or contact Suzanne Meeves.

What we ask of you
â€¢	Review: Audit any active processes, reports, or integrations that reference Troux on or after 3/9.
â€¢	Prepare: Plan to transition day-to-day APM activities to the Console UI on 3/9.
â€¢	Do not use Troux after 3/9, reach out to your SBU Lead or Suzanne Meeves with any questions.

Thank you for your support and cooperation as we complete this critical modernization.
If you have immediate questions, please consult the APM Knowledge Management area in Console or contact your Market(SBU) APM Lead.

Best regards,
AJ Wasserman
GDS â€“ Strategy, Data & Delivery

column1: Wiz Vulns added to Vuln Workbench for EC2 Instances w/o a Tenable Agent
column7: GCS & GDS Market Action Center - Horizons
column46:
*Originating Market* - GCS Threat Defense & Response (TDR) - Threat and Vulnerability Management (TVM)

*What is Happening?*

Wiz vulnerabilities related to EC2 Instances without a Tenable Agent were added to the Vulnerability Workbench. The SLA dates for the vulnerabilities will be calculated as follows:

* +Very Critical+ - Start Date of 3/2/26 with Remediation *Due 3/17/26* (15 days)
* +Critical+ - Start Date of 3/2/26 with Remediation *Due 4/2/26* (30 days)
* +High+ - Start Date of 3/2/26 with Remediation *Due 6/2/26* (90 days)

*Why is it Happening? What is driving this work?*

Wiz EC2 vulnerability data is being surfaced to the Vulnerability Workbench to close a 30% gap in EC2 instances where Tenable is not scanning nor providing visibility into current vulnerabilities.Â 

*Who is impacted/in-scope for this initiative?*

All EC2 instances without a Tenable agent are in scope. Please refer to the Open Findings Report to view EC2 vulnerabilities requiring remediation [+Enterprise Vulnerability Workbench - Open Findings+|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/apps/509c4550-1f67-47a1-8a5e-dbd8e392cdf3/reports/d51684c8-0036-48a2-9a08-834e5d5c1d5f/ReportSection?ctid=08a83339-90e7-49bf-9075-957ccd561bf1&experience=power-bi]

*Market(s) Impacted*

* USRM
* GRS
* LIFTED
* GCS
* GDS

*What actions do those impacted need to take?*

# Remediate vulnerabilities per the above SLA dates
# Re-platform to a Liberty Mutual supported AMI or enroll EC2 to 90 day redeploy where applicable
# Work with vendor to address identified vulnerabilities
# IF SLA cannot be met work with BISO team to open an Archer Extension and share finding number with Threat and Vulnerability Management Team via their Service Desk [+TVM Service Desk+|https://forge.lmig.com/issues/servicedesk/customer/portal/958]

*What happens if required actions are not complete by the due date (i.e., business disruption, costs, etc.)?*

If vulnerabilities are not remediated per the stated SLAs, then those will report as breaching SLA in the Vulnerability Dashboard; Threat and Vulnerability Management team uses an Incident process to escalate/manage such vulnerabilities. If a team is not able to remediate a vulnerability, then they may consider opening an Extension via the existing Archer process.

*Do you have an impact list (i.e., excel, report, etc.)?* Yes, [https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/apps/509c4550-1f67-47a1-8a5e-dbd8e392cdf3/reports/d51684c8-0036-48a2-9a08-834e5d5c1d5f/ReportSection?ctid=08a83339-90e7-49bf-9075-957ccd561bf1&experience=power-bi|https://app.powerbi.com/groups/me/apps/509c4550-1f67-47a1-8a5e-dbd8e392cdf3/reports/d51684c8-0036-48a2-9a08-834e5d5c1d5f/ReportSection?ctid=08a83339-90e7-49bf-9075-957ccd561bf1&experience=power-bi|smart-link]. 

Use the following filters in the Vulnerability workbench to see the impacted resources:  

* Remediation Required = All 
* Asset Type = Server (AWS EC2)
* Source = Wiz 

*What is Driving the Due Date? Why was this date selected?*

SLA dates are in accordance with defined vulnerability requirements and standards. [+Remediation SLAs - GCS Threat & Vulnerability Management - Confluence+|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GVM/pages/390170046/Remediation+SLAs]

*Communications Strategy & Related Resources*

For further assistance, please contact TVM through their [Service Desk|https://libertymutual.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/958] or Attend Office Hours.

*Product Owner or Support Contact:* Emily Proulx and Craig Newcomb

28/Jul/20 11:16 AM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;Confirmed the following info related to Mobile Passphrase and Google Pixel supplies:
 * Mobile engineering has confirmed Google has a supply constraint
 ** Upgrade devices are not able to select a Google Pixel device
 ** New device purchase have option to select Google device
 ** No ETA on delayed supplies or how long it will take a New device to be delivered

 ** There is currently a 16 character limit with Email+
 ** Temporary resolution is to ask user to limit passphrase to exactly 16 characters or;
 ** Utilize one of the other email options moving forward (Outlook or Gmail)
 ** Will need to make scripting changes to advise this prior to Passphrase rollout

column1095:
27/Feb/25 10:49 AM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Mac and Mobile Sprint Review - Meeting notes:*+

* *Privacy Guidance for BYOM:* Amarendara discussed the updated privacy guidance for bring your own mobile (BYOM) light, addressing common privacy concerns and clarifying the visibility and management of personal data on mobile devices. They compiled and published an article with Kevin Hill's help.
** *Privacy Concerns:* Amarendara highlighted common privacy concerns such as visibility of personal data, call logs, SMS messages, and local files when using personal devices for work. They clarified that Intune's mobile application management functionality protects intellectual data on managed applications, ensuring personal data remains untouched.
** *Article Compilation:* Amarendara and Kevin Hill compiled and published an article addressing these privacy concerns, detailing the differences in data visibility and management between personal and company devices.
* *Contractor BYOM Light Updates:* Amarendara explained the updates for contractor BYOM light access, including reviewing approved vendors and updating wikis and FAQs with relevant data. They worked with contracts to ensure the master service agreement accommodates BYOM language.
** *Vendor Requests:* In January, several users from companies like EXL Holdings and New Era Tech requested BYOM light access. Amarendara's team reviewed the approved vendors list and worked with contracts to ensure the master service agreement included BYOM language.
** *Wiki and FAQ Updates:* The team updated wikis and FAQs with relevant data and questions to ensure all information was current and accurate for users.
* *Android Improvements for Microsoft Teams Rooms:* Amarendara provided an update on Android improvements for Microsoft Teams rooms, mentioning the transition from device administrator to Android open source project (AOSP) and extending existing configuration policies to the new platform.
** *Transition to AOSP:* Amarendara explained the transition from the deprecated Android device administrator to the Android open source project (AOSP) for managing Microsoft Teams rooms. This change required updating existing policies to the new platform.
** *Policy Extension:* The team extended existing configuration policies to the AOSP platform, ensuring the same restrictions, controls, and configurations were applied. They thanked the Turner team for simplifying the process with relevant licensing groups.
* *Android Minimum Version for Passkey Testing:* Amarendara mentioned the ongoing passkey testing on Android devices, highlighting that Android 14 or newer versions will support the passkey configuration. Jimmy is leading this activity.
* *Enhancements to BYOM Lite Enrollment App:* Kathleen discussed the enhancements made to the BYOM Lite enrollment app, including moving it to a dedicated production environment, modernizing it, and updating information on access and eligibility for different roles.
** *Production Environment:* Kathleen explained that the BYOM Lite enrollment app was moved from personal productivity to a dedicated production environment, enhancing its stability and performance.
** *Modernization:* The app was modernized by removing the custom connector and other elements that made it a premium app. References to outdated tools like MobileIron were also removed.
** *Updated Information:* Information on what BYOM means, access, and eligibility for different roles was updated to provide clearer guidance to users.
* *Passkeys and Fish-Resistant MFA:* Kyle provided an update on the progress of passkeys and fish-resistant MFA, with around 3600 devices registered. They also mentioned improvements in help hub scripting and self-service support items.
** *Device Registration:* Kyle reported that approximately 3600 devices have been registered with passkeys for fish-resistant MFA, with about 100 devices remaining to be registered before enforcement.
** *Help Hub Improvements:* Improvements were made to help hub scripting and self-service support items, including troubleshooting steps and self-service options for refreshing entry registrations.
* *Sequoia OS Adoption:* Kyle reported on the adoption of Sequoia OS, with over 83% of devices on the latest version. They mentioned the challenges faced and the progress made despite not publicizing its availability.
** *Adoption Rate:* Kyle reported that over 83% of devices are on the latest Sequoia OS version, despite not publicizing its availability. The OS was released in October 2024.
** *Challenges:* Kyle mentioned the challenges faced with Sequoia OS, including bugs and issues that delayed enforcement. The team is now ready to start enforcing the OS version.
* *Apple TV Deployment:* Kyle discussed the deployment of Apple TVs in executive offices, partnering with the Video Solutions team and other teams to manage the devices via jamf and ensure proper configuration and authentication.
** *Deployment:* Kyle explained the deployment of Apple TVs in executive offices, primarily in Boston, in partnership with the Video Solutions team. The devices were added to automated device enrollment and managed via jamf.
** *Configuration and Authentication:* The team worked with Inkasabian's team and Entrust to create a new digital ID for the Apple TVs, allowing certificate renewal and proper configuration and authentication.
* *Password Incidents and Nomad Retirement:* Kyle explained the investigation and analysis of password-related incidents, improvements in help hub scripting, and the upcoming retirement of Nomad. They also mentioned partnering with Tech Start orientation to address password-related questions.
** *Incident Analysis:* Kyle discussed the investigation and analysis of password-related incidents, identifying issues related to FileVault, password syncing with Nomad, and false positive lockouts.
** *Help Hub Improvements:* Improvements were made to help hub scripting, making it easier for L1 and L2 techs to identify and resolve password-related issues.
** *Nomad Retirement:* Kyle mentioned the upcoming retirement of Nomad, which is expected to reduce password-related incidents. The team is working closely with Apple to resolve a bug causing false positive lockouts.
** *Tech Start Orientation:* The team partnered with Tech Start orientation to provide a Mac-specific orientation, addressing password-related questions and other relevant topics for new developers.
* *Passkey Enforcement and BYOM Workflow:* Kathleen mentioned the team's involvement in the passkey enforcement rollout communication plan and the modification of the BYOM workflow to require more frequent terms of use acceptance.
** *Passkey Enforcement:* Kathleen mentioned the team's involvement in the passkey enforcement rollout communication plan, ensuring users are informed about the changes.
** *BYOM Workflow:* The BYOM workflow will be modified to require terms of use acceptance every six months, instead of just once during initial enrollment.
* *Approval for Apple AI Pilot:* Kathleen announced the approval for piloting Apple AI from the Responsible AI Committee, with plans to identify a user group and communicate its responsible use.
* *Mobile Phone Setup Enhancements:* Kathleen mentioned the team's efforts to enhance the user experience when purchasing and setting up mobile phones, as well as reviewing Archer items assigned at the end of last year.
** *User Experience:* Kathleen mentioned efforts to enhance the user experience when purchasing and setting up mobile phones, aiming for a smoother and more optimal process.
** *Archer Items:* The team is reviewing Archer items assigned at the end of last year to ensure all tasks are addressed and completed
column1096:
01/May/25 1:17 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Mac and Mobile Sprint Review - Meeting notes:*+

* *Mac OS Version Update:* Kyle discussed the recent update to the Mac OS version minimum to 15.4.1, which was released on April 16th. They mentioned that 71% of the devices are already compliant with this version, and they plan to enforce this minimum version on the client side soon.
** *Compliance Rate:* Kyle mentioned that 71% of the 3700 Mac OS devices are already compliant with the 15.4.1 version, indicating a strong voluntary update rate among users.
** *Future Enforcement:* Kyle explained that the enforcement of the 15.4.1 minimum version on the client side has not yet begun, but plans are in place to start this enforcement soon to ensure all devices meet the required standards.
** *Pre-Stage Enrollment:* Kyle highlighted that a change will be rolled out to the pre-stage enrollment process, enforcing a Mac OS minimum version during device enrollment to prevent sub-15.4 devices from being enrolled.
** *Azure Compliance:* Kyle mentioned that compliance updates will also be applied to Azure-compliant devices, ensuring they meet the 15.4.1 minimum version requirement.
* *Apple Intelligence Pilot:* Kyle announced the approval to begin piloting the Apple Intelligence writing tools built into Mac OS Sequoia. They mentioned that a pilot group will be formed to provide feedback on these tools.
** *Pilot Group:* Kyle stated that a pilot group will be formed to test the Apple Intelligence writing tools and provide feedback on their effectiveness in improving productivity.
** *Communication:* Kyle mentioned that an announcement was made on Slack to recruit volunteers for the pilot group, aiming to gather diverse user feedback.
* *Zscaler Version Upgrade:* Kyle informed the team about the upgrade to the newest Zscaler package, version 4.3.1.102, which provides user enhancements. They mentioned that 95% of the environment is already on this version.
** *Upgrade Status:* Kyle reported that 95% of the environment has been upgraded to Zscaler version 4.3.1.102, with only a few devices remaining to be updated.
** *User Enhancements:* Kyle noted that the new Zscaler version includes user enhancements, although specific details of these enhancements were not provided.
* *Leveraging Data in Splunk:* Kyle highlighted the team's efforts in leveraging data sent to Splunk from the Jamf admin console. They demonstrated some high-level dashboards created to gain better insights into authentication types and file vault retrievals.
** *Data Integration:* Kyle explained that data from the Jamf admin console, including file vault access and API authentication requests, is being sent to Splunk for better insights.
** *Dashboard Demonstration:* Kyle demonstrated high-level dashboards showing authentication types, geolocation data, and file vault recovery key retrievals, providing visual insights into these metrics.
** *File Vault Retrievals:* Kyle detailed the visualization of file vault recovery key retrievals, including total counts, top users, and events for the last 24 hours, aiding in monitoring and investigation.
** *Script Issue Resolution:* Kyle shared an example where the visualization of failed authentication attempts helped identify and remediate expired credentials in a script, preventing further issues.
* *Passkey Rollout:* Jim provided an overview of the upcoming Passkey rollout, explaining its purpose and the different types of authentication that work with Passkey. They emphasized the importance of using a Passkey equivalent when using MFA.
** *Passkey Overview:* Jim explained that Passkey is a more secure MFA method that eliminates the need for usernames and passwords, using methods like Windows Hello for Business, Platform SSO, and mobile passkeys.
** *Windows Hello:* Jim mentioned that Windows Hello for Business is already enabled on all physical 111 devices, allowing users to log in with a PIN instead of an enterprise password.
** *Platform SSO:* Jim described Platform SSO for Mac, which allows users to unlock their passkey using their local Mac password or Touch ID, similar to Windows Hello for Business.
** *Mobile Passkey:* Jim highlighted the complexity of mobile passkeys, noting that the Authenticator app can be used for multiple MFA types, and emphasized the need for Android 14 or newer for compatibility.
** *Preparation:* Jim stressed the importance of preparing for the Passkey rollout by ensuring devices meet the necessary requirements and updating users on the new authentication methods.
* *M365 Access Policy Change:* Jim discussed the recent change to the M365 access policy, which removed access from personal web browsers to M365 applications. They explained the impact on users and the need for managed or registered devices.
** *Policy Change:* Jim explained that the M365 access policy change, implemented on April 21st, removes access from personal web browsers to M365 applications, requiring managed or registered devices.
** *User Impact:* Jim noted that the policy change caused confusion and escalations, particularly affecting users who use Incognito or private browser windows, as these do not support registered device status.
** *Chrome SSO Extension:* Jim mentioned that Mac users using Chrome may face issues if they have not signed into the Chrome SSO extension, which was rolled out during the Platform SSO rollout.
** *BYO Devices:* Jim clarified that bring-your-own (BYO) devices should continue to work, but users may need to register their devices before logging into applications like Outlook and Teams.
* *Network Configuration Changes:* Jim mentioned the recent changes to network configurations on all platforms due to a change in the certificate used on the authentication server. They highlighted the significant effort required to deploy these configurations.
** *Certificate Change:* Jim explained that the network configuration changes were due to a change in the certificate used on the authentication server, requiring client configurations to be updated on all platforms.
** *Deployment Effort:* Jim highlighted the significant effort involved in deploying the updated configurations to all platforms, including Windows, Mac, Apple TV, iOS, and Android company devices.
* *Upcoming Plans:* Kathleen outlined the upcoming plans, including more waves of Passkey enforcement, raising the minimum iPhone OS standards, refining the Apple AI pilot, continuing with Jamf resiliency, and focusing on HPE.
** *Passkey Enforcement:* Kathleen mentioned that there will be multiple waves of Passkey enforcement, with the goal of having all eligible users enforced by July 22nd.
** *iPhone OS Standards:* Kathleen stated that the minimum iPhone OS standards will be raised, although specific details on the new minimum version were not provided.
** *Apple AI Pilot:* Kathleen noted that the Apple AI pilot will be refined, ensuring participants have taken the required AI training and understand how to leverage the tools based on best practices.
** *Jamf Resiliency:* Kathleen mentioned the continuation of Jamf resiliency efforts, focusing on aligning test and production environments and documenting the value of automations.
** *HPE Focus:* Kathleen indicated that the team will select a focus area for HPE (High-Performance Environment) and work through it over the next six weeks.
column1097:
26/Jun/25 12:42 PM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Mac and Mobile - Sprint Review (6/26/25)*+

* *Mobile Updates:* Jim provided updates on the mobile team's activities, including the impact of Apple's WWDC announcements, improvements in app distribution with iOS 26, and the ongoing investigation into managed Apple IDs. They also discussed the challenges of enforcing OS update minimums and the progress of the Mobile Passkey project.
** *WWDC Announcements:* Jim highlighted the significance of Apple's WWDC announcements, focusing on the new OS updates and management changes. He emphasized the importance of staying informed about consumer experience changes like Liquid Glass and Apple Intelligence, which could lead to additional questions from users.
** *iOS 26 App Distribution:* Jim discussed the improvements in app distribution with iOS 26, particularly the granular controls over app updates. This aims to enhance user experience by preventing issues like app updates blocking access to essential apps when not on Wi-Fi.
** *Managed Apple IDs:* Jim mentioned the ongoing investigation into managed Apple IDs, noting the disruptive nature of this change. The team is monitoring improvements and capabilities to determine how they can be utilized effectively.
** *OS Update Minimums:* Jim addressed the challenges of enforcing OS update minimums for iOS and Android devices. The team is currently warning users running outdated versions and plans to block these versions next month to support the Mobile Passkey project.
** *Mobile Passkey Project:* Jim provided an update on the Mobile Passkey project, noting that nearly 13,000 employees have been enrolled. He emphasized the importance of setting up mobile passkeys early to enhance security and convenience.
* *Mac Updates:* Chris highlighted the publication of a ServiceNow article to help users transition from Windows to Mac and provide context for AI models. They emphasized the importance of reducing support requests and frustration, preventing common mistakes, and providing official resources through Apple articles.
* *Mac OS 26 Beta Testing:* Kyle discussed the team's internal beta testing of Mac OS 26 (Mac OS Tahoe) and their goal of achieving a day zero release for the general Liberty Mutual population. They plan to take volunteers for beta testing closer to the fall release.
** *Beta Testing:* Kyle explained that the team has begun internal beta testing of Mac OS 26 (Mac OS Tahoe) using developer beta 2. They are testing enrollment use cases, platform SSO, and critical applications to identify any blockers to a rollout.
** *Day Zero Release:* The team aims to achieve a day zero release for the general Liberty Mutual population. They plan to take volunteers for beta testing closer to the fall release to ensure a smooth rollout.
* *Apple Intelligence Writing Tools:* Kyle announced the release of a pilot for Apple Intelligence writing tools on 55 devices. The team will gather feedback on productivity and how these tools can help users in their day-to-day applications.
* *GitHub Actions Migration:* Kyle explained the team's efforts to migrate from Bamboo to GitHub Actions for deployment pipelines. They highlighted the advantages of GitHub Actions, the internal and external actions available, and the creation of a wiki to summarize the information.
** *Migration Efforts:* Kyle detailed the team's efforts to migrate from Bamboo to GitHub Actions for deployment pipelines. He highlighted the advantages of GitHub Actions, including ease of use and the availability of internal and external actions.
** *Internal Actions:* Kyle mentioned the existence of numerous internal actions specific to Liberty Mutual, which have been written by other users. These actions are documented in a GitHub list, making it easier for the team to utilize them without reinventing the wheel.
** *External Actions:* Kyle explained that there is a list of pre-approved external actions that can be used within Liberty Mutual's GitHub environment. This ensures security compliance and prevents issues with unauthorized actions.
** *Wiki Creation:* Kyle has been creating a wiki to summarize all the information related to GitHub Actions, making it accessible to the team and other interested parties within DWE. This resource aims to streamline the migration process and provide clear guidance.
* *Mac OS Tahoe Features:* Andrew shared details about Mac OS Tahoe, including the new liquid glass interface, integration of Platform SSO registration into the Setup Assistant, and enhancements to Spotlight for automation and productivity.
** *Liquid Glass Interface:* Andrew described the new liquid glass interface in Mac OS Tahoe, which offers a refreshed user experience with customizable colors and transparencies. While it doesn't impact device management, it enhances the overall user experience.
** *Platform SSO Integration:* Andrew highlighted the integration of Platform SSO registration into the Setup Assistant. This allows users to register their Mac for device compliance and set up a passkey during the initial setup process, streamlining the onboarding experience.
** *Spotlight Enhancements:* Andrew discussed the enhancements to Spotlight, which now includes automation and productivity features. Users can set up workflows and scripts directly within Spotlight, improving efficiency and reducing the need for third-party tools.
* *Support App Customization:* Andrew discussed the customization of an open-source support app to improve the Mac OS onboarding experience at Liberty. The app provides useful information about the machine, alerts for disk space and software updates, and aims to reduce tech help incidents.
** *Support App Features:* Andrew explained the customization of an open-source support app to improve the Mac OS onboarding experience. The app provides information about the machine, such as last reboot time, disk space, and pending software updates.
** *Onboarding Experience:* The support app aims to enhance the onboarding experience for new Mac users at Liberty, particularly those transitioning from Windows. It offers a centralized location for accessing self-service and support resources.
** *Tech Help Reduction:* Andrew emphasized that the support app is designed to reduce tech help incidents by providing users with essential information and alerts, such as when their Mac hasn't checked in with Jamf or when disk space is low.
* *Upcoming Projects:* Jim outlined the team's upcoming projects, including continued support for Passkey enforcement, raising minimum OS standards, monitoring iOS 26 and Mac OS 26, and implementing password policy changes to align with the Win 11 experience.
** *Passkey Enforcement:* Jim stated that the team will continue to support Passkey enforcement, aiming to enable it across all devices. They will also look at mobile device upgrades and new hire processes to ensure Passkey is integrated into all activities.
** *OS Standards:* The team will continue to raise the minimum OS standards to align with Passkey enforcement and other security concerns. They plan to enforce these standards during the next review.
** *iOS and Mac OS Monitoring:* Jim mentioned that the team will continue to monitor iOS 26 and Mac OS 26 to plan for any significant changes or vendor engagements required. This proactive approach aims to address potential issues early on.
** *Password Policy Changes:* The team will implement password policy changes for Mac OS to align with the Win 11 experience. This involves moving away from enterprise passwords to separate passwords for Mac and Passkey access, enhancing security and user experience.

Follow-up tasks:

* *Mobile Passkey Setup:* Encourage all employees to set up their mobile passkey as soon as possible to enhance security and convenience. (Jim)
* *Mac OS Tahoe Beta Testing:* Begin taking volunteers for beta testing Mac OS Tahoe closer to the fall release. (Kyle)
* *Support App Customization:* Continue refining the support app and seek volunteers to test it and provide feedback. (Andrew)
column1098:
04/Aug/25 9:28 AM;557058:85ee93a6-e3f7-45c0-946e-feea53716d8e;+*Mac and Mobile - Sprint Review (7/31/25)*+

h3. *Key Topics:*

* *Mobile OS Updates:* Amarendara provided an update on the status of mobile OS updates, highlighting that 94.65% of iOS and iPadOS devices are updated to version 1841 or higher, and 96% of Android devices are updated to version 14. They plan to block devices that are not updated. 1
* *Android Patching Vulnerabilities:* Amarendara discussed the monthly security vulnerabilities patching for Android devices, noting that 61% of the managed devices are updated. They aim to have the remaining devices patched by the end of next week. 2
* *Passkey Rollout:* Jim updated the team on the passkey enforcement program, mentioning that 28,000 accounts are now enforced for passkey. They are addressing support calls and planning to improve the process for users getting new devices. 3
* *Mac OS Beta Testing:* Kyle reported on the beta testing for Mac OS 26 (Tahoe), stating that the team has had good success with Beta 4 and is working closely with Apple to ensure day zero support readiness. 4
* *Approved Web Browsers:* Kyle announced the completion of the effort to uninstall Firefox from all Mac OS devices, with only Edge, Safari, and Chrome now supported. 5
* *Zscaler Deployment:* Kyle informed the team about the deployment of Zscaler 4.5.0238 to all Mac OS devices, which includes incremental improvements to the Zscaler experience. 6
* *Automation Efforts:* Kyle highlighted the automation work done over the years, estimating that it saved about 80 hours of productivity in the past 30 days. They plan to continue improving these automation processes. 7
* *Future Plans:* Kathleen outlined the next steps, including continued analysis of iOS 26 and Mac OS Tahoe beta testing, implementing Edge Mobile DLP controls, and addressing remote desktop work for an Archer finding. They will start wave planning next week. 8
